front.title: Membership Verification for Autonomous System Sets (AS-SETs)

abstract.t: This document defines a new object type, member-of-as-set, for use in Internet Routing Registry (IRR) databases. The member-of-as-set object enables autonomous systems to declare membership in AS-SET objects, creating bidirectional verification of AS-SET expansions.

section.name: Introduction
section.t: Internet Routing Registry (IRR) databases have long been used by network operators to generate BGP route filters.
A fundamental limitation of current AS-SET objects is their unidirectional nature. An AS-SET owner can include any autonomous system without requiring authorization.

section.name: Terminology
section.t: The key words MUST, SHOULD, etc. are defined in BCP 14 .

section.name: The member-of-as-set Object
section.t: The member-of-as-set object allows autonomous systems to declare AS-SET membership.

section.name: Implementation Status
section.t: A proof-of-concept implementation has been developed demonstrating the feasibility of member-of-as-set verification using existing toolchains. The POC uses standard Unix tools (bash, grep, bgpq4) and requires no modifications to IRR infrastructure.

ul.li: Verification can be implemented as a wrapper around existing AS-SET expansion tools without modifying bgpq4 or IRRd
Performance impact is minimal for typical AS-SET sizes
Backward compatibility is maintained - ASNs without member-of-as-set objects are accepted by default

section.name: IANA Considerations
section.t: IANA is requested to register the member-of-as-set object type.
